sub_title: Assistant Professor: Academic Research and Writing Advisor at UMC Utrecht
summary: Experienced academic researcher and writer with a demonstrated history of working in and outside of higher education. Accomplished published author in academic journals, books, and popular history. Strong education professional with a Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) in History from Royal Holloway, University of London. Through my experience as a research and writing advisor I have gained wide-ranging knowledge in a number of different fields from Dentistry, Pharma, Psychology, Housing, Cyber Security, and Finance.  For the last two years, I have been working as a research and writing advisor for the Graduate School of Life Science at University Medical Center Utrecht. In this role, I supervise the capstone projects for the Life Science and Society Profile, co-coordinate and teach the Logical Argumentation in Science course, coordinate and teach the interdisciplinary History of Medicine course, in addition to advising Biomedical Education PhD students with their theses and publications.

education.grade: Distinction on my thesis and a Merit overall

profile_positions.description: Research and coach for PhD students in the Biomedical Medical Sciences Research Team
profile_positions.title: Research and Writing Coach

profile_positions.description: Designing and co-coordinating along with teaching a workshop on how to write a successful grant application in addition to supervising students for their group projects.
profile_positions.title: Co-coordinator and research and writing advisor for the Logical Argumentation in Science MA course

profile_positions.description: Supervising student capstone projects and teaching an introduction to research approach. Guiding the students through all aspects and components of conducting a social science study in addition to teaching writing skills.
profile_positions.title: Capstone Supervisor for the Life Science and Society MA profile
Coordinator for the History of Medicine and Biomedical Sciences MA course UMC/UU

profile_positions.description: I was hired to research a number of different topics from genealogy, military history, medieval history, and local history. The information was then written up and used in television programs, journals, family trees, and books.
profile_positions.title: Freelance Historical Researcher and Writer

profile_positions.description: Copy editing, content editing, researching, and proofreading for a handful of academics, authors and publishing companies. Responsibilities include editing academic theses, websites and blogs, books, letters, emails, CV and cover letters.
profile_positions.title: Consultant Editor and Proofreader

profile_positions.location: London, United Kingdom and Utrecht, Netherlands
profile_positions.description: I advised a number of students with their studies, research development skills, writing skills, and coursework. In this role I gained significant knowledge in a number of different fields from psychology, sports medicine, medical apparatuses, dentistry, cybersecurity, finance, and the Know-your-Customer (KYC) lifecycle along with policy directives and guidelines of adherence.
profile_positions.title: Consultant Academic Tutor/Advisor

profile_positions.description: Responsible for helping develop content, research, and editing for several publications and social media platforms.
profile_positions.title: Chief Consultant Editor

profile_positions.description: Responsible for helping develop content, research, and editing for several publications and social media platforms.
profile_positions.title: Chief Consultant Editor

profile_positions.description: Responsible for performing a thorough investigation on a range of geographical components (mainly buildings) that were identified as having a degree of significant merit. These reports were then used by the local governing bodies, financial investors, and building companies as guides of consideration for planning decisions.
profile_positions.title: Heritage Asset Researcher and Writer

profile_positions.description: Eyeforpharma is a business intelligence company that focuses on innovation in the health industry. I preformed investigative research on shifting trends and practices within the industry. Additionally, I interviewed industry leaders from scientist to CEOs of major pharmaceutical companies along with government policy makers. The overall outcome of these reports were then sold to senior-level pharma executives, patient advocacy groups, and other health experts.
profile_positions.title: Freelance Medical Researcher and Writer

profile_positions.description: My job as the finishing coach was to bring fresh eyes and perspective to a crew in the lead up to the Boat Race. I was responsible for finding the last bit of speed the crew needed to gain the advantage. I trained the coxes in race strategy, water and boat knowledge, health and fitness advice, and crew motivation. I was also there to motivate and keep them focused before the big day.
profile_positions.title: Finishing Coach for the Oxford University Women's Lightweight Rowing Club
